meanings.definition: A category or class of things or people.
meanings.sent1: In the store, you can find different kynds of fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She sorted the books into various kynds based on their genres.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the animals formed their own kynds for a talent show.
meanings.sent4: The students were like different kynds of puzzle pieces, each fitting into a unique group.
meanings.sent5: The forest was filled with countless kynds of trees, creating a beautiful mosaic of colors.

meanings.sent1: Birds of the same kynds tend to flock together during migration.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the behavior of different kynds of ants in their natural habitats.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic turned into a competition between the kynds of cousins.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky formed kynds of constellations, telling stories in the night.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden bloomed in various kynds, attracting bees and butterflies.
